pages.sentence: I am at the bakery. I see the open door. I smell warm bread.
pages.readingTip: Read each sentence and picture it in your mind.

ui.imagePrompt: Cozy bakery storefront at a station, warm light, calm style.

pages.question: Where am I?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the place name.

pages.sentence: I see little pies on a tray. I see a big cake on the top shelf. I see warm buns.
pages.readingTip: Little tells size. Big tells size too.

ui.imagePrompt: Bakery counter with labeled tray of pies and a cake on a high shelf.

pages.question: What do I smell?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the smell words.
pages.successMessage: Nice! You used the story to find it.

pages.menuStory: The treats look good. What will I pick?

ui.imagePrompt: Three bakery item cards with simple icons.

pages.question: What was little?
pages.passage: I see little pies on a tray.
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the word after little.

pages.sentence: I want a sweet treat. I pick a pie. It tastes so good!
pages.readingTip: Go back and read the key sentence if you forget.

ui.imagePrompt: Child holding a pie happily at a table, cozy bakery.

pages.question: Where is the cake?
pages.passage: I see a big cake on the top shelf.
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find where the cake is.
pages.successMessage: Yes! You found where it is.

pages.sentence: I find a blue hat on a bench. No one is holding it.
pages.readingTip: Think: first, next, last.

ui.imagePrompt: Train stop with a bench and a blue hat left on it, calm style.

pages.sentence: I look around. I see a boy. He looks sad.
pages.readingTip: Retell by saying the steps.

ui.imagePrompt: Child looking around; another child nearby looking sad but calm.

pages.sentence: I ask if the hat is his. The boy says yes. I give it back.
pages.readingTip: Use the story to answer the question.

ui.imagePrompt: Handing the hat back kindly, gentle smiles.

pages.menuStory: I have the hat. What is the kind choice?

ui.imagePrompt: Three choice cards with simple icons, calm colors.

pages.sentence: The boy smiles and I feel proud. Helping is a kind thing to do.
pages.readingTip: The message is what the author teaches.

ui.imagePrompt: Warm scene of two kids smiling; small heart sticker.

pages.question: What happens first?
pages.passage: I find a blue hat on a bench.
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. This is the first event.
pages.successMessage: Yes! You found the first event.

pages.question: What happens last?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. This is the last event.
pages.successMessage: Nice! You found the last event.

pages.question: What did the author teach me?
pages.passage: Helping is a kind thing to do.
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. It tells the message.

pages.sentence: I am at the pet shop. Mia is with me.
pages.readingTip: Characters are who. Setting is where.

ui.imagePrompt: Pet shop station with a friendly fish tank, calm style.

pages.question: Who is with me?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the name.

pages.sentence: Mia looks at a fish tank. The fish swims in the water.
pages.readingTip: Look for the sentence that answers the question.

ui.imagePrompt: Close-up of fish tank with a fish swimming, kid-friendly.

pages.menuStory: We can choose one pet to watch.

ui.imagePrompt: Three pet choice cards: fish, cat, bird.

pages.sentence: We pick a fish. Mia feeds the fish.
pages.readingTip: Events are what happens in the story.

ui.imagePrompt: Mia gently feeding fish flakes into a tank, calm.

pages.question: Where am I?
pages.passage: I am at the pet shop.
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the place.

pages.question: What does Mia look at?
pages.passage: Mia looks at a fish tank.
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find what Mia looks at.
pages.successMessage: Nice! You used the story details.

pages.question: What happens in the story?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the action.

pages.sentence: I go on a picnic. I feel happy.
pages.readingTip: Feeling words tell emotions.

ui.imagePrompt: Calm picnic blanket scene with simple food and smiles.

pages.sentence: Then I spill my drink. I feel sad.
pages.readingTip: Go back to the sentence to find the answer.

ui.imagePrompt: Small spill on the blanket; calm cleanup, not upsetting.
Three feeling word cards with simple faces.

pages.sentence: I clean it up. I feel proud.
pages.readingTip: Find the word that tells a feeling.

ui.imagePrompt: Child calmly cleaning up and smiling with a star.

pages.question: How do I feel at the picnic?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the feeling word.
pages.successMessage: Yes! You found the feeling word.

pages.question: What happens?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the action.

pages.question: How do I feel after the spill?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the feeling word.

pages.question: Which word is a feeling word?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the feeling word.
pages.successMessage: Nice! Proud is a feeling word.

pages.sentence: My cat talks to me. He says hello.
pages.readingTip: Fiction can have make-believe events.

ui.imagePrompt: Cute cat with a small hello speech bubble, friendly and calm.

pages.sentence: Cats have whiskers. Whiskers help cats feel.
pages.readingTip: Nonfiction tells real facts.

ui.imagePrompt: Simple nonfiction page about cats with labeled whiskers.

pages.menuStory: I can read a story or facts.

ui.imagePrompt: Three book cards: story, facts, both.

pages.sentence: Fiction is make-believe. Nonfiction is real.
pages.readingTip: Ask: Did this really happen?

ui.imagePrompt: Two labels: fiction and nonfiction with simple icons.

pages.question: Which sentence is fiction?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Can a cat really talk?

pages.question: Which sentence is nonfiction?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Is it a real fact?
pages.successMessage: Nice! That is a real fact.

pages.question: What does fiction mean?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the meaning word.

pages.question: What does nonfiction mean?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the meaning word.

pages.sentence: I walk to the pond. I see ducks.
pages.readingTip: If the text says I, the narrator is I.

ui.imagePrompt: Calm pond scene with ducks, first-person viewpoint.

pages.sentence: Mia walks to the pond. She sees ducks.
pages.readingTip: If the text uses a name, the narrator is not that name.

ui.imagePrompt: Same pond scene but showing Mia from the outside (third-person).
Three narrator choice cards: I, Mia, Ducks.

pages.sentence: The narrator is the one who tells the story.
pages.readingTip: Look for I or a name.

ui.imagePrompt: Simple definition card for narrator with a pointing finger.

pages.question: Who tells this part?
pages.comprehensionHint: Look for the word I.

pages.question: Who tells this part?
pages.comprehensionHint: Look for the name Mia.
pages.successMessage: Nice! Someone else tells about Mia.

pages.question: What is a narrator?
pages.passage: The narrator is the one who tells the story.
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find who tells the story.

answers.name: The one who tells the story

pages.correctAnswerName: The one who tells the story

pages.sentence: I am at the kite park. I hold a red kite.
pages.readingTip: Use the picture and the words.

ui.imageAlt: Picture shows a child holding a red kite.
ui.imagePrompt: Sunny park with a red kite, gentle style.

pages.sentence: The wind is strong. The kite goes high in the sky.
pages.readingTip: Find the sentence that tells the answer.

ui.imageAlt: Picture shows the kite high in the sky.
ui.imagePrompt: Kite flying high with soft clouds, calm.
Three kite color cards, simple and bright.

pages.sentence: I pull the string gently. I can keep the kite steady.
pages.readingTip: Read the words, then look at the picture.

ui.imagePrompt: Child holding kite string, calm smile.

pages.question: What do I hold?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find what I hold.
pages.successMessage: Yes! You used the words to find it.

pages.question: How is the wind?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the describing word.
pages.successMessage: Nice! You found the describing word.

pages.question: Where does the kite go?
pages.passage: The kite goes high in the sky.
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find where it goes.
pages.successMessage: Yes! You found where it goes.

pages.sentence: Sam likes the drum. Mia likes the flute.
pages.readingTip: Compare means same and different.

ui.imagePrompt: Music room station with a drum and a flute, calm style.

pages.sentence: Sam plays loud. Mia plays soft.
pages.readingTip: Look for words that show differences.

ui.imagePrompt: Split scene: drum with loud icon, flute with soft icon.
Three music choice cards with simple instruments.

pages.sentence: Both kids smile when they play music.
pages.readingTip: Both means Sam and Mia.

ui.imagePrompt: Two kids smiling while playing music, gentle style.

pages.question: Who likes the drum?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the name.

pages.question: Who likes the flute?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the name.

pages.question: How are Sam and Mia different?
pages.passage: Sam plays loud. Mia plays soft.
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find loud and soft.

answers.name: Sam plays loud, and Mia plays soft
Sam and Mia both play loud
Sam and Mia both play soft

pages.correctAnswerName: Sam plays loud, and Mia plays soft
pages.successMessage: Yes! You compared the two characters.

pages.question: What do both kids do?
pages.passage: Both kids smile when they play music.
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the action word.

pages.sentence: Rain on the train. Tap, tap, tap. I wear my cap. Clap, clap, clap.
pages.readingTip: A poem can have a rhythm.

ui.imagePrompt: Train in gentle rain; poem text on a scroll, calm style.

pages.sentence: Before I read, I think about what I know about rain. Rain can make the ground wet.
pages.readingTip: Use prior knowledge to get ready to read.

ui.imagePrompt: Thought bubble with rain and wet ground, gentle style.

pages.menuStory: If it rains, what will help me?

ui.imagePrompt: Three item cards: umbrella, raincoat, sunglasses.

pages.sentence: The sky is dark. Gray clouds move in. I think it will rain.
pages.readingTip: A prediction is a smart guess.

ui.imagePrompt: Dark clouds rolling in; child holding umbrella.

pages.sentence: Raindrops tap on my umbrella. My prediction was right.
pages.readingTip: Confirm your prediction by checking the text.

ui.imagePrompt: Raindrops on umbrella with a small check mark, calm.

pages.question: What is in the poem?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find the word rain.

pages.question: What do I do before I read?
pages.passage: Before I read, I think about what I know about rain.
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find what I think about.

pages.question: What do I predict?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Find will rain.

pages.question: Was my prediction correct?
pages.comprehensionHint: Read the sentence. Right means correct.
